title: Turn on Family Sharing
subtexts: Go to Settings and tap your Aple ID at the top
Tap “Family Sharing”
Tap “Continue”
Tap the “+” icon to add a family member
additionalInfo: Haven’t activated your iPhone yet? Check out our guide here.

title: Add child to Family Sharing
subtexts: Select “Create Child Account”
Enter your kid’s name and birthday and tap “Verify You’re an Adult”
Provide or verify your existing payment method to verify parental consent If you already have a credit card saved, you’ll be asked to enter the CVV.
Enter your credit card details if you’re providing a new card
Read and agree to the Family Privacy Disclosure
Read and agree to the Terms and Conditions
Create an email address for your kid’s Apple ID or use an existing one and tap “Continue”
Create a password for their Apple ID
Confirm the parent phone number or use a different one — a verification code will be sent to whichever number you enter

title: Set up Apple Screen Time
subtexts: Turn On Screen Time
Do not tap “Turn On Restrictions” yet — change your restrictions to match our recommendations (see pictured) and then tap “Turn On Restrictions”
Turn On Communication Safety
Select screen downtime for your kid’s iPhone and tap “Turn On Downtime”
Set up a Screen Time passcode to manage parental controls
Tap “Continue”
Tap “Share Location”
Tap “Done”

title: Adjust other Screen Time settings
subtexts: Go to Settings
Select Screen Time
Scroll down and tap on your kid’s name
Select Content & Privacy Restrictions
Go to “Allow Changes” and set all to “Don’t Allow”
Tap “Allowed Apps”
Set your restrictions to match our recommendations (see pictured)

title: Set up your kid’s device
subtexts: Go to Settings on their iPhone
Tap “Sign in to your iPhone”
Sign in with your kid’s Apple ID
Enter the verification code sent to the parent’s iPhone
Enter an iPhone passcode for your kid’s device if prompted
additionalInfo: Havenâ€™t activated your iPhone yet? Check out our guide here.
